Description: Stamp (vessel): half-qisṭ. Seven line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 265. Cf. Miles, G.C. 1964. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo, 25.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (155)
Lane Poole S 1891 / Catalogue of Arabic glass weights in the British Museum (p.107, no.391)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
